result.execSummary:
The defendant Darren Marcus Hewison was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Darren Marcus Hewison

records.addlTxt: No possession or use of prescription medications or controlled substances without valid prescription and ONLY in dosage - manner as prescribed.

3:33 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Darren Marcus Hewison appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Mary L. Roth Burns appeared by video for Darren Marcus Hewison. Calling 22CF64, 22CF62, 22CM18, 22CM25, 22CM68, 22CF11 & 22FO129. 22CM68 set for a Adjourned Initial Appearance. 22CF62 & 22CF64 set for a Competence Hearing. Court has reviewed competency report. Burns has reviewed with Defendant - Defendant is competent to proceed - Medication has been adjusted - Not challanging report. Court finds Defendant is competent to proceed. Burns in receipt of complaint, waive reading - not guilty plea. Court will set out for preliminary hearing in 3 of the cases. Burns has received offer - will review with Defendant. Burns/Schiek statement to bond. Court will modify bond in 22CF62 & 22CF64 adj. 03:38 PM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 29, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

11:06 AM Prosecuting attorney Mary M Sowinski Ms. appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Darren Marcus Hewison appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Mary L. Roth Burns appeared by video for Darren Marcus Hewison. Calling 22CF64, 22CM68, 22CF62, 22CF11, 22CM25, 22CM18, 22FO129. Victim appears by phone in 22CM68. Court statement - notes competency report has not been completed. Facility requests extension. Burns makes request for bond reduction to signature bond w/condition that he be released if bed available in dual diagnosis facility. Hewison statement. Court needs further information and will entertain request after more information provided. Sowinski statement. Adj. 11:15 a.m.
Competency hearing scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 03:30 pm. in 22CF11, 22CF62, 22CF64

1:18 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Darren Marcus Hewison appeared in court, in custody, Attorney Mary L. Roth Burns for Darren Marcus Hewison appeared in court. Calling 22CF62 & 22CF64. Burns states filed motions for competency evaluation. Court will have orders prepared. In receipt of complaint, right to counsel. Schiek/Svehlek statement to bail. Court sets bond of $1,500 cash in 22CF62 & $1,500 cash in 22CF64. Court holds off on forfeiture in other cases adj. 01:27 PM
Competency hearing scheduled for March 23, 2022 at 11:00 am.

1:16 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Darren Marcus Hewison appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Mary L. Roth Burns appeared in court for Darren Marcus Hewison. Calling 22CF62 & 22CF64. Burns in receipt of complaint in 22CF62 does not have complaint for 22CF64. Court will set out.  adj. 01:19 PM
Initial appearance scheduled for March 9, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
